It had an extra cost of $75 but after speaking w/him agreed to additional charge. We were very excited, as we had not stayed at this hotel in the past 5 years, but before this time had stayed many times and had been very pleased. Upon arrival we were given the “Jr. Suite” which seemed to be a standard room with 2 queen beds. I went to the front desk, and asked about the sofa sleeper, and explained this was the reason I had upgraded to the “Suite” over the standard queen. They told me there must have been some mistake. They offered a larger suite, which had a sofa sleeper, with no view to compensate. I told them the reason for our stay was for the view. They then stated they had a comfortable “Aero” bed which had an additional $20 charge, which they were willing to comp for the misunderstanding. We received the bed, which was a little twin blow up mattress, which rested directly on the floor. After we had settled into our room, we began to hear hammering and pounding from the room below our room. We called the front desk to ask about this. They informed us the room below us was under construction, and was being re-carpeted. We asked how long the pounding would continue and we were informed it would be another hour. The hammering and pounding continued all afternoon. We had to leave the room because the noise was so loud. When we returned to the room, and went to sleep, the blow up bed I was sleeping on had a hole in it, and I slept the entire night on the floor. In the morning, we went to get a towel from the pool area to take to the beach. The security guard yelled at us, and treated us like we were criminals-he wanted to know how we got into the pool area. I explained I had used my key. The guy seriously needs to learn some customer service skills. I went to the front desk, and spoke to the same lady I had been speaking to all along, blonde with glasses. She had a great big smile, and tried to pacify me with it. She wanted to make things “right” for all of our hassle. She told me that we could stay another night at no charge. I asked her which room we would be able to stay in. She told me we could not stay in our same room, because it was booked. She had someone show me a room they could offer us. The room was a large room, w/NO VIEW... the view was of a hotel next to ours. Upon returning to the front desk, we told her it would not work for what we had paid to stay, she said there was another room with an excellent view that might be available, and that we should go and do our daily activities, and then she would call us when she knew if it would be available. After waiting 1 hr, we had not heard back, so we went to have breakfast…. Again HUGE disappointment… it is not what it used to be. We returned to the front desk, and asked her what were the plans. She still did not know. By this time, it is 10:30am, and we need to know if we need to pack up our stuff and check out, or move to another room. We asked to see the room, but she refused to show it to us. We told her we could not make a decision, until we were able to see what kind of a room they were willing to offer. She said she was not able to show it to us, but encouraged us to just "take the offer". We then went to the 2nd floor, where the room was that they were offering, and saw the door open, and asked the maintenance staff who were working on the room if we could take a peek. There was no view, except for a view of the parking lot and public beach bathrooms. Once we saw the view, we understood why she refused to show us the room. We then called the front desk, and told them we would be checking out, and we wanted a discount on our room for all of the issues we had experienced. Upon checkout she had a smile on her face, but her body language showed our issues were a serious inconvenience for her.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER SORRY I STAYED HERE”
Reviews.Author: Pickeetravelor
Reviews.Content: In a time when customer service is poor, this place goes out of there way to make sure you are happy. This is my second time staying here and once again. They knocked it out the park. The ocean view is fabulous. Sleeping with the ocean waves right outside can't be beat. Even though there was a frig problem, they replaced it immediately. Folks can by the room just to see if we needed anything further. If I ever go back to San Diego, I will definitely stay there again. Honestly, the ocean is the star. I really couldn't tell you much about other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jillybeancaz
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The employees were all very helpful and nice. The room was very cute and overlooked the ocean. The location was great to get out and walk along the beach and within walking distance of many restaurants. My husband and I have only good things to say about this hotel, and we are some of the pickiest people around. We will probably stay here again on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome ... it's what vacation is all about!”
Reviews.Author: RainySilverton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent close to a week at the hotel. Positive friendly staff who always said hello to us no matter where we were in the building. A sweet smelling spotless room with a comfy bed, beautiful ocean view, soft bathrobes, chocolate on our pillows, etc., etc. I can't say enough good things about our stay here. I don't know why this hotel isn't #1. Just walk out of the lobby into the friendly Pacific Beach community and there are lots of great places to eat, sand dollars to find and surfers to watch. Not to mention that awesome sea lion I saw on the beach. Wow. The pool was beautiful and warm too. What a great stay... but now that I'm back home in Oregon all I can do is go to the pacific terrace hotel web cam and dream about my next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise and personal attention all in one”
Reviews.Author: kuck
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel has the most professional, accommodating, and friendly staff I have ever encountered. I love to vacation and highly recommend this hotel to anyone who values great customer service and a feeling of paradise on their vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: BeachGal815
Reviews.Content: Arrived late afternoon and was greated by a smiling bellman who offered to take our luggage and our car. Every staff member we encountered from then on out was top of the line. We had booked a full ocean view junior suite which fit the bill in every way except for the view (we are very, very picky) which looked out over the pool and then to the ocean. When we asked to be moved we were accomodated quickly and shown several other rooms to choose from. We settled on a corner room (but not a junior suite) with a view of the ocean and coastline as far as the eye could see. We spent much time on our terrace with books and afternoon cocktails. We had a decent continental breakfast included in our room rate -- additional items or a hot cooked breakfast could be added. Breakfast on the terrace was lovely but a bit chilly - a heater or two would have been nice. Pool was small but well kept and our kids really enjoyed it. Concierge service was superb - weather it was making dinner reservations (try JRDN for dinner), ordering take out for us or getting tickets to the zoo. My only minor complaint was the cost of parking - $20 per night. I realize that parking in the beach areas is precious but given the room rate parking could have been a little cheaper or even included. Having said that, we've decided this is our new home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: floribabe
Reviews.Content: I picked this Hotel because of the good reviews on Tripadvisor and I was not disappointed. I can not say one negative thing about this Hotel. The location right on the beach was great my beautiful room overlooked the Pacific Ocean the room was large bright and spotlessly clean and believe me my standards are very high my Husband says I am really hard to please. The front desk were very helpful and were always available to ensure your stay was perfect .Gerard the manager should be very proud of the way his staff conduct themselves nothing is too much trouble for them. We had a continental breakfast every morning and this was very organised not like the normal bun fight that can occur in some breakfast buffets in hotels I have stayed in, once again the staff were really polite and helpful a special thanks to the lovely Nancy who always made sure you were ok. What else can I say except I would like to make the Trans Atlantic trip back real soon I can not wait to return as it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: hernameiscalifornia
Reviews.Content: I really would like to give some props to the staff at the Pacific Terrace. One of the most impressive things was how you were greeted every time you came and left the building. Everyone was happy and friendly, and they even addressed you by name when you called the front desk. Pacific Beach turned out to be one of the coolest beaches around, with plenty of surfers and even kite-surfers to watch from the balcony. Garnet Ave. shops and nighlife are right around the corner, tons of restaurants and even a CVS are right around the area, and I had a great time at Hennessey's down the way for Karaoke Night. They have some nice cabanas around the pool, too. The only thing I didn't care for was the kind of mossy green color of the building; even so, It's obvious when you go there that Pacific Terrace is THE place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: LGP6868
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace hotel the first week in San Diego for Spring Break. We loved so much about this hotel! First, the location. It's in Pacific Beach, which is just south of LaJolla. Whereas LaJolla has hoity-toity boutiques, fancy restaurants, and Bentley dealerships, Pacific Beach has taco stands and surf shops. It's got a casual, funky, surfer-dude feel. We loved it. If you don't want to have to get dressed up, and you want to walk to any number of casual seafood restaurants for dinner, this is the spot for you. THe hotel is right on the boardwalk, but about two blocks down from the more commercial area, so you avoid the noise and chaos. You access the beach by going down a staircase. We could watch the surfers from our balcony window. The view is amazing. The pool is small, but managed somehow, even during spring break with lots of families there, to have seats for everyone each time we went. The pool has a glass wall separating it from the boardwalk, which allows a great view, but protects from the wind. Our room, a suite, was very large and comfortable. The furnishings are a little bit dated, but very nice nonetheless. The staff bends over backwards to make you comfortable, whether it's cocktails by the pool or going to nearby restaurants to pick up "room service" for you. Any complaints were answered promptly and with great care.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable, even better in person”
Reviews.Author: PSDesertRat
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful, staff was excellent, room was amazing and the view was unbelievable, definitely get a full ocean view room. Could have used a restaurant in house, but otherwise the place is amazing. The Ritz Laguna while fantastic, is twice the price and in my opinion not twice the value. Go for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Vta_dude
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pacific Terrace for my birthday with my wife and daughters. Room was beautiful and spacious. The only reason I gave it a very good instead of excellent was the fact that we got a room with a jacuzzi tub and the tub did not work. I was a little disappointed when they didn't give us any kind of break on the room for this feature not working. They told me it would be working the next time we came, but that didn't help us out at the time. Other than that, it is a very nice place to stay and everyone on the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best location on PB”
Reviews.Author: lookin4bluewaters
Reviews.Content: We've been wanting to come stay at the Pacific Terrace for a very long time now, and finally took advantage of the "stay 2 nights, get 1 night free promo"! The rooms go for $400+ and up, so the promo was well worth it. When we checked in they offered, for us to upgrade to an oceanfront suite, but with a pretty steep price, so we declined, We got a first floor room with a peek-a-boo view of the ocean from the private patio and easy access to the beach. Our only complaint was the thin walls, you can hear footsteps from the 2nd floor, and doors slamming out in the hallway, due to us being close to the exit. Hotel staff asked us numerous times if our stay was okay and if we needed anything. I did complain about the noise, but they only offered to tell the party upstairs to lower it down. (I was hoping they'd offer to move us to a nicer room). Being that we're here on Spring Break and it is a kid-friendly hotel, I told them it was okay, as long as we can sleep at night. Plus, we have our two kids with us as well, but they made us realize they aren't as naughty and hyper compared to our temporary neighbors! All in all, the Pacific Terrace's location is enough reason to want to stay her if you're looking to enjoy Pacific Beach. It was easy for us to get our kids onto the sand and hang out all day without having to drive anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “everything impressive top to bottom staff best i have encountered”
Reviews.Author: wow45
Reviews.Content: from the time we arrived to the the time we left staff was unreal. rooms kept superb every request met . could not imagine any better place to stay in the area . full ocean view room just perfect . never enjoyed a stay more in my life same for wife and daughter will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: rntlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in several hotels during our vacation in California and the Pacific Terrace was our favourite! Everything was perfect! The rooms, the view, the location and the staff. Our only quibble would be the complimentary breakfast. We disliked the cramped breakfast room and also how the breakfast was served. At any other hotel you are free to help yourself but here, you have to ask for each item (bagel, muffin etc.) You are allowed one choice along with cereal, fruit and yogurt. It was just o.k. You can purchase a regular breakfast but the price was exhorbitant. We enjoyed our stay so much that I am hesitant to complain about this, but this is the only hotel where we didn't enjoy the breakfast routine and would prefer eating breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Special This Spring”
Reviews.Author: Pacific-Specific
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, spectacular view, clean and dependable smaller hotel. What sets this hotel apart from the rest on Pacific Beach are the gorgeous views it provides from a cliff top above the ocean (think tremendous ocean breezes and sensational sunsets) and the most courteous, friendly and accommodating service staff you could hope for. From the time you set foot in the Pacific Terrace, you are welcomed and catered to, without any sense of invasiveness. From the front desk to the wait staff to the cleaning personnel to the maintenance people, you are treated with a smile and an attentiveness to your needs. Pacific Beach might not be for everyone, but if you want the ocean and a lively port from which to see San Diego, your choice for a base and a retreat to return to has to be the Pacific Terrace. Angela Hansen, Gerard McNearney, Rachel, Danielle -- there are so many wonderful people to assist you through your stay. Don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “"THE" Most Amazing place to stay in LaJolla”
Reviews.Author: mdmsings
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed this hotel tremendously, the staff is wonderful, including Danielle in reservations, Matt at the front Desk. They made our vacation perfect. The view from our room was beautiful and the room itself luxurious. We cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: S_L_1234
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The staff is awesome beyond belief, the rooms are wonderful, the beds were comfortable, and the view is out of this world. I could go on and on but if you are staying in San Diego this is the place you want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrBurnsChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights with our 18 month old son in late February. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated and very comfortable. Great location on the beach within walking distance of many restaurants. We will most definitely return to the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Deadiebear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace in early February and wish we could visit it every day! We absolutely loved the place and can not say enough great things about it. From the fantastic staff, to the spacious room to the outstanding view...I can't think of a single negative thing about it!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a real gem of a boutique hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Birdmanhiker
Reviews.Content: This is a real gem of a boutique hotel. Perfectly situated on the beach with views of surfers, kite surfers, people walking and biking along the promenade. The hotel is perfectly situated near the north end of the ocean front walking/bike path away from the hustle and bussell but close to restaurants and service. It is also a short stroll along residential streets lined with beautiful ocean front homes and secluded beaches to La Jolla. The hotel itself is lovely, only three stories high very large, well decorated rooms with large sliding glass doors opening onto spacious and private balconies. The pool and deck area is well appointed with a glass wall providing a wonderful view of the beach but with wind protection and privacy from the public walking path along the beach. The hotel service was very friendly and helpul with employees going the extra mile to make our stay both personal and enjoyable. We will definitely return and have already recommended the hotel to many friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace Hotel exceeded our greatest expectations above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMissy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I very much enjoyed our stay! The staff was exceptional! We were warmly greeted the moment we arrived and taken excellent care of during our 5 night stay. Very well kept property. Pool and spa area very clean as well. Excellent service for breakfast also. Great beach access. Alot of good restaurants within walking distance. Great area to enjoy walking directly on the beach as well as the walkways. Our first visit to San Diego together and certainly not our last as long as we can stay at this hotel period! The rooms were very comfortable and beautiful! We enjoyed the oceanfront views from our 3rd floor balcony The most amazing sunsets. Well worth it!!!! Our heartfelt thanks to the entire outstanding staff!

Reviews.Title: “The very best in Pacific Ocean Views”
Reviews.Author: mnkazoo
Reviews.Content: The most appealing in sea side accomodations, Pacific Terrace Hotel has wonderful views of the ocean with night time lighting that enhances the appearance of the waves. Wooden shutters in the room are an excellent accent to the experience. The bedding is top quality and eye-catching. A facility filled with wonderful people and poolside brunch that cant be beat. I would be pleased to call this place "Home" Jason Peterson, Minneapolis, Minnesota USA

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, best hotel on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: Kona15
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Pacific Terrace and it is just the best. If you want to stay ON the beach in Pacific Beach, La Jolla or Mission Beach, this is the place to be. It is a great, central location between these locations and the beach is at your doorstep. You walk outside the hotel and the boardwalk is right there. It is so clean, the people are freindly and the rates are competitive. Pool is great. I am really picky when it comes to hotels, and I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION EXCELLENT STAFF EXCELLENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: spacewrangler_uw
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pacific Terrace Feb 19 - 21 the location is top notch, close to EVERYTHING. The staff was very helpful and customer experience was outstanding. We received a comp glass of wine our first night and enjoyed it on our balcony watching the sunset over the Pacific Ocean. The view from our room (Ocean View) was more then we could have asked for, breath taking views and slept with our sliding door open to enjoy the sound of the waves as we fell asleep each night. The spa service was also great and at a good value. The rooms were very clean and the staff was prompt for all our needs. We will be back FOR SURE couldn't image a better place to stay in the San Diego area. Owning my own business I appreciate good service, you guys have your stuff together don't change a thing. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family members. Thanks Pacific Terrace for making and amazing weekend even more enjoyable. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Staycation Paradice”
Reviews.Author: KellyW717
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel to celebrate a birthday on a whim. We travel all over the US all the time and live in SD, Ca. This is our all time Favorite Hotel so far!!! The location, the rooms and the views made you feel like you were on a wonderful vacation. I only wish we could have stayed longer! High praise as we mostly stay at High end Hotels and were worried as this is not a chain with a reputation we could look at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccipups
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel. We had an ocean view room, #318, with 2 queen beds. The room was quite large and comfortable. It had a small fridge, microwave, bar sink, and some plates, flatware, and a coffeemaker. We enjoyed leftovers on the balcony one evening. The balcony has a table a 4 chairs and can easily accommodate 4 people. The beds are comfortable but the wraparound decorative frame, while handsome, makes it a little harder to get into bed. This was a really comfortable hotel with a friendly helpful staff. We thought the location was terrific. We were just outside the busiest sections of the boardwalk, but close enough to walk to restaurants along the boardwalk and on Mission St. (Ave? Blvd?) The hotel doesn't have a full service kitchen and only serves breakfast. The kitchen makes a good omelette and good waffles though. We paid $200/nt plus $20/day for garage parking. It's a beach community and the hotel's on the beach so finding on street parking that isn't time limited is really hard. Would we stay here again? Absolutely! The large, comfortable room, location, view, and friendly staff made this short getaway very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jad2360
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Pacific Terrace celebrating my 50th birthday. The weather was great (compared to what we left in Chicago), the view from our two balconies was spectacular and the staff was exceptionally attentive. The coffee maker didn’t work and it was replaced within minutes of us calling down. They even helped us ship home all the wine we purchased. The rooms are spacious and clean, with tropical décor. The electronics (TV, DVD,) are top of the line. Can’t think of one problem/complaint. Would definitely return and highly recommend. My husband still goes their web site to see the view from the webcam of the beach.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay On Pacific Beach!”
Reviews.Author: UtahCoco
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at thwe Pacific Terrace Hotel and we loved it and will definitely return. The room(A Jr Suite) was wonderful and the bed was so comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and really knew the area well as far as recommending places to see and eat at. The Breakfasts were great as was the staff that worked in the breakfast room. Definitely one of the best hotels I have stayed in for the price!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, excellent service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: nevermissabeat
Reviews.Content: A speedy check in and an upgraded room, a very good start. This hotel has a lovely location on the beach front, close to Sea World and plenty of bars etc down the front. A smallish but pleasant pool area, was fine when we visited in basically low season, I imagine it's very busy in summer and could be a bit crowded. We had breakfast once in the hotel and it was fine although nothing special, we then went to the supermarket and got some breakfast items to keep in the room. The room itself was very nicely done, lovely balcony with a great view, always clean and a quality feel to everything. Excellent job, would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “I wish my friends didn't want to stay here every year (they love the beach)”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne33
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel many times-- probably 10 or 12 due to business in the area.. Sure, it is great to be at the beach -- especially when you normally live in a cold, damp or otherwise unattractive climate. Pacific Terrace is in a great location for watching the Pacific, the surfers, the skaters, and also some highly transient people who frequent this area. The staff are young but try to be very helpful and many of them will go out of the way to assist. But they do not have the experience to provide superior attention to details that many reviewers have come to expect. Their intentions are the best but in my observation the hotel management seems to be absentee. When the rooms were redecorated 4-5 years ago they brought in horrible beds that have huge wooden frames. They were supposed to be luxurious -- but fail miserably. The beds are high and the wooden frames are very large and uncomfortable when one gets into and out of the bed. They probably cost the hotel a fortune (or maybe not-- perhaps the manufacturer realized their design flaws) but they seem as if they will be around for a while although they look dated now. (Management has even added a small set of steps to use to get into the bed--like the ones you see on TV for your dog) Large flat screen TV is supposed to compensate for the bed issues I imagine... (don't forget your remote) Over the years I have found that the rooms are VERY variable in cleanliness, view, comfort and amenities. If you don't like the first room you are assigned, ask for another. Unless you want to keep tabs on children and the pool, I strongly advice a second or third floor for the view and the improved security (although the property is secure-- the open door to a private balcony is better than a room where people parade by and can look in..) They need to go to a better system for breakfast-- The management should simply find a way to include it. I am sure I'll be back but would rather stay on the harbor. Oh and the fitness center room is in the moldy basement. Luckily one can just go outside for a run.

Reviews.Title: “It is a best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: Alphabetsoup2
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most enjoyable get-aways we have had in a very long time. The entire staff at Pacific Terrace went out of their way to make our stay pleasurable. Particulary we appreciated the quality of furnishings, decore and ambiance and the high standards for cleanliness, customer service and most certainly the sound of the ocean waves washing against the shores 24 hours a day. Actually, we would do better not recommending this hotel, for it would be to our benefit us to keep it a best kept secret!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms-spacious stop on a Cali coastal tour”
Reviews.Author: Sandy41
Reviews.Content: One of several stays on the the Southern California coast. We had a one bedroom w/ kitchenette. While the room was huge-we found there was alot of wasted spaceand ineffecient use of the large space. A bit over "decorated" for a beach hotel. One huge bathroom with a large plasma screen tv (never even turned it on)and lots of mirrors. One problem with 5 of us including teenage girls-there was no privacy (or separate shower area) in the BR- so if someone was showering you couldnt use the mirrors to do hair/make up, etc. There was not a separate area in the main room to get ready. Staff was very nice and accomodating. Location is great-near LaJoya and San Diego. One of the nicer hotels in the Pacific beach area-we would stay in LaJoya or San Diego if we came again...Pacific Beach was more of a college crowd beach and we ended up driving into San Diego alot. (3 night stay). Overall a nice hotel with spacious rooms and a great staff. Nice beach views and decent pool.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back”
Reviews.Author: Domine
Reviews.Content: It's a toss-up...either the staff or the location vies for first place, but both are outstanding. We've not found many hotels that have prepared their staff as well as this to welcome and acknowledge guests at every opportunity. The concierge was knowledgeable and helpful in dining arrangements. The breakfast crew was wonderful. The place is not inexpensive but is well worth every cent. The property lies on the walk along the pacific ocean. A seven mile walk along the ocean and along mission bay makes for an unforgettable workout. There are so many sights along the way the miles fly by. We've been at Pacific Terrace half a dozen times and have never been disappointed. We can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCARDS
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated on the north end of Pacific Beach. You can walk to restaurants and bars. You can rent bikes, walk, roller blade, or just walk the coastline. We visted the zoo, old town and did the segway tour which is all 5-10 minutes from the hotel. There si never any traffic in the city Had a room overlooking the ocean and saw dolphins in the morning and awesome sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Urban Beach Scene”
Reviews.Author: Janetdoe
Reviews.Content: Really liked the Pacific Terrace hotel. It's a smaller three story hotel overlooking Pacific Beach, separated from the beach by the popular 3 1/2 mile boardwalk. Our room was nice, decorated in a Caribbean/tropical theme. Nice limestone bathroom, separate sink area with a mini fridge. Everyone working there is super friendly and helpful. Complimentary continental breakfast included lots of choices: cereals, fruit, yogurt, bagels, pastries, coffee, juice. At breakfast you can also pay for a cooked meal, but lunch and dinner are not offered, nor is there a bar in the hotel. (Complimentary glass of wine delivered to your room on your first night, and of course, lots of watering holes nearby.) I think all the rooms have at least a partial ocean view, which is how our room (208) was listed, but I really couldn't have asked for more "view." Our balcony was good sized, overlooking the ocean and the courtyard where the pool and hot tub are. Didn't make it for a workout in the fitness center which is a small room in the parking garage, but got plenty of exercise on the boardwalk and in the pool. The location is great, couldn't be closer to the water, and right on the city bus line. Lots of restaurants and a grocery store within walking distance. Loved Pizza Amore for salad and thin crust New York style pizza. Would not return to the Green Flash restaurant, and the restaurant JRDN (yes, that's spelled correctly) was too hip for us---think "ultra lounge" but the food was good (and pricey). I would definitely return, but probably only in winter. If you're a people-watcher you'll love the 24/7 walker-jogger-bike-rollerblade-segway-skateboard-dog-stroller traffic (got the picture?) on the boardwalk, but if you like your privacy you might find the constant parade a little intrusive. Even though the courtyard and pool area are walled and gated, a large part of the wall is glass so that you can see the ocean, but the boardwalk users can look into the courtyard and even into your room if you haven't closed your shutters. In January even during bad weather, the boardwalk was used pretty heavily and I'm sure it's crazy crowded in summer. But that's the urban beach scene and I don't fault the hotel itself for that.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more...can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: SummitCo
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace is an out of this world hotel with an ideal location in one of the best cities for vacationing ever!. It is small enough to be inviting and cozy, but comes with the service of a larger hotel. The accommodations are superb, magically making you feel like you’re retreating in the tropics; with plantation shutters you’ll want to take home, lovely tapestries, and great beds all within a spacious and comfortable oasis. This hotel truly exemplifies excellent customer service! All of the welcoming hotel staff is exceptional, from the cheerful front desk employees ready to lend a hand in any situation to the caring and efficient parking attendants. (My daughter and I were visiting colleges and we asked a lot of info from the guys up front…pay attention to their “local” picks!) The ocean breezes will lull you to sleep (we kept our doors open to the Pacific every night!) and the deep blue Pacific turns a golden ginger with the breathtaking sunsets you can watch from your patio! Days can be as relaxing or busy as you want; attractions are just a few miles away but far enough to leave that bustle behind! A few steps and you’re feet are in the sand, the walking path is just steps away, and the pool and jacuzzi are sparkling! The photos really might not do it justice! We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing- Wow- The Best I've Ever Experienced”
Reviews.Author: Mishka22Australia
Reviews.Content: I had to write a review and tell everyone to stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. The most amazing place I have ever stayed. The room was immaculate, large and provided more than I needed. The view was spectacular on the beach and at night from the heated jacuzzi the hotel light up like a romantic dream. I am very very fussy and I am not easily pleased, but the Pacific Terrace pleased me beyond my expectations. The Presidential suite had a plasma, xbox, great bar, spa, robes and made me feel like I was staying at a Bali resort. The staff were great, friendly and genuine- especially Matt. Thankyou, I will be telling everyone in Australia to come to San Diego and stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much, even with an 18 month old!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Mom_K
Reviews.Content: If you have a toddler, this is the place to go. We just stayed for nine nights and had a ball. 1. Its family-oriented -- quiet overall (you aren't competing with drunken boppys) and private enough that when your kiddo cries you don't feel like you are waking the whole place. 2. Close to everything (restaurants, pharmacy, grocery store all walkable). 3. The staff is AWESOME!!!! 4. They provide breakfast in house (and delivery or take in every eve). 5. The provide pack-and-plays. 6. LOCATION!!!! Right on the boardwalk for long walks, and on the ocean for sand and viewing surfers. The hotel was quiet (towards the Northern End) but you could walk into action and fun easily. 7. The pool was nice and warm! Kiddo-friendly, and the hot tub too. 8. The staff is AWESOME!!!!!! (I know I said this before, but it needs repeating). We checked out the Coronado (beautiful but wildly busy), Paradise Island (you are really out of what is going on), Loews (terrible location)...no where is better than the Terrace in my opinion. I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional people, lovely rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Oregonfuncouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and the Pacific Terrace far exceeded our expectations. We upgraded to a junior suite so we could have 1 King bed, so I would suggest that to couples. The staff are exceptional in all areas, this is s "hidden gem" on Pacific Beach. We watched surfers from our private balcony. There are great shopping opportunities and restaurants are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel right on (above) the beach”
Reviews.Author: SideRoad
Reviews.Content: Well appointed rooms. Great service. Kids loved daily turn-out service with fancy chocolates (milk & dark) in a cute cloth bag. Daily operation/service gave the feel of upscale hotel with daily-printed note in the room with photos and name of front desk folks working that day/evening and tomorrow's weather forecast. Even the housekeeping person left a personal card. Very comfortable bed. I don't like soft beds, but I liked theirs. A big flat screen TV was nice. Heated pool was great. Stayed in a first floor room. Didn't have view of the ocean (though it was called "partial view"), but all I had to do with step out few feet from the back porch to enjoy the ocean view. It was too cold for swimming, but we dipped out feet in the cold sea. Many surfers and wind surfers in the morning. Fun to watch. Refrigerator in the room was nice. They wrongly charged us for the mini-bar, but upon protest, they promptly corrected the error. Their hotel description didn't say anything about having to pay for wireless internet. Other amenities requiring surcharge was clearly listed. Wi-Fi was not listed among those for-fee amenities. However, I learned that they charge $10-$12 per day for Wi-Fi. They gave me the first day free. I didn't use Wi-Fi after the free day, since they had a desktop with printer for guests in the hallway near the front desk. They should clearly state about charging for Wi-Fi. BTW, I think all hotels should provide free Wi-Fi. Charging for it is like charging for cable TV channels. I rather have free Wi-Fi and for-fee cable channels. Cheap roadside motels like Best Western provides free Wi-Fi. What's up with upscale hotels charging for it? I parked on the street everyday. Never had problem finding a spot or safety. As people leave the beach in the evening, spots always opened up. Front desk people will tell you where you can park for free. The spots near the public restroom is swept every weeknight, and you can't park there overnight. Overall, it is a very nice hotel with upscale service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: fancylittlelaminated
Reviews.Content: I brought a group to the Pacific Terrace in December, 2007, knowing only what I learned from tripadvisor. Our stay could not have been better, from the excellent group sales manager, to the front desk staff, to the amazing accomodations and view. It was perfect in every way. I will, and have, recommended to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace!”
Reviews.Author: MariVet
Reviews.Content: The room overlooked the coast...service was excellent. Every employee, from my original call to make reservations through checkout, was friendly, cheerful, and helpful. The room was clean and well decorated. Rarely have I seen a hotel staff work so diligently to make the stay pleasant. The rate was excellent for a hotel of this quality. I highly recommend the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “A Thanksgiving to remember!”
Reviews.Author: mrualex
Reviews.Content: My mom, living in the desert loved our California beaches but we never made it to Pacific Beach. Sadly, because of failing health resulting from degenerative spine problems, we had to cancel several attempts to go this past year. She passed away in mid August. In memory of our mom, my sister, her husband and I, thought it would be nice to embrace her love of the ocean and spend Thanksgiving at Pacific Beach. The Pacific Terrace Hotel and the location is super! It is a charming elegant hotel. Instead of booking a room for my sister and her husband and a room for myself , we took the spacious "master suite" . If you view the video tour and click the master suite you can see how nice it is. I slept on the pull-out sofa bed- it has an inflatable mattress and they include an electric pump that's easy and fast to use. Let me tell you- it was soooo comfortable! As you can see in the video tour, there are two spacious balconies overlooking the ocean. You can really enjoy the relaxing sounds of the waves as you drift off to sleep. That's what's wrong with some of the mega resorts- your too far away from the beach that you can barely see or hear anything. The Pacific Terrace Hotel, their grounds as well as our suite were extremely clean, the staff is friendly and helpful and makes you feel welcomed. We had a nice light breakfast at the hotel and later a wonderful Thanksgiving buffet at World Famous, a restaurant on the beach only a short walk away. There are many other nice restaurants, all kinds of shopping, bars and taverns, and clubs within a short walking distance. Weather was in the mid to upper 70's. with just a slight breeze, lots of surfers and kite surfers, to keep you entertained. My sister and her husband who have traveled a lot were "impressed", as my sister likes to refer to places she likes a lot. I just say that the Pacific Terrace Hotel and it's location is terrific-lots of fun and a great place to visit and stay. Somehow, I just know mom enjoyed this visit too. Michael Cathedral City, Ca.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE HOTEL, STAFF AND STAY”
Reviews.Author: InsideTrack
Reviews.Content: We used Trip Advisor to find a more upper-scale hotel to stay at for this trip to San Diego. We have been to San Diego many times before, but now that our children are older, we wanted something out of the Hotel Circle Drive area. Voila, the Pacific Terrace Hotel. We weren't sure what to expect, having booked this site unseen. But we were pleasantly surprised when we checked in. Even during the booking (by phone), reservation staff were friendly, personable and extremely accomodating. At check-in, the staff were laid-back and ensured everything was in order before we went up to our room. The room was beautiful and the balcony (oceanview) was incredible. Carpets could've used a cleaning, but it's normal wear and tear. The hotel was so quiet, that our upstairs neighbours actually called to complain about our noise, lol (we are usually the ones calling to complain). We were on the balcony around 9pm the night we checked in and probably were a bit loud. Breakfast at the hotel is extremely reasonable and is served every morning. Housekeeping is timely and does a great job. All other staff are great and they met our every request and asked us lots before we had to if we needed anything. Only downside is the beach neighbourhood. The area is full of the stereotypical "California beach bum" type. Not necessarily a negative if that's what you are expecting. The boardwalk is very close to the rear of the hotel, but far enough that you don't get any noise from passers by. We slept with the balcony door open at night and felt completely safe. Swimming pool is great, although they could use a more experienced bartender. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel and although it was a little pricier than most, it was well worth the service, the beach and the environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ltagne
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic - overlooking the ocean. If can't afford a room with a view, it's not a problem, 'cause you get the same view from a swimming pool, where we spent most of our time. Soft chairs to lie at the pool on by the way. We got it cheap through hotels.com, paid 89 USD for weekdays and 99 USD for weekend (+ 8,75% tax). Very cheap for such a value. It's on the ocean front walk, so you can stroll morning or evening for a long time if you wish. Plenty of restaurants close by. The hotel only serves breakfast (not included in the price). Free internet. Parking is free on the street, so take it - there are places and you save 20 USD pr. day! The hotel is not big, but the rooms are very very roomy! It's built in '80s, but was renovated around 5 years ago, so all tiles and bathrooms are new, only the carpet is old. All rooms have either a balcony or terrace. And a big TV with plenty of channels. And a fridge. And they can provide a microwave if you need it. We found the place to be quiet, which was very relaxing. The staff was very friendly and willing to solve any issue. Except one thing - we prolonged our stay by 3 nights and said we'll need to pay cash (as we were leaving the USA), but upon check-out I was told that the credit card was already charged. Hm... not a nice thing to stand with 300 USD in cash, when your plane is taking off the same day. Also, since we prolonged the stay, we got a 2nd welcoming call, as if we had just checked in:) Another weired thing - two evenings the staff knocked on the door to deliver the note who's on duty, ask if we needed anything (if we would, we would call!) and give us some small chockolates. So not necessary to disturb. One evening we even had a privacy sign on, but they locked themselves in anyway! We found it very weired. All in all we would warmly recommend this place as great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “So many things went wrong it was comical.”
Reviews.Author: Bigpenny34
Reviews.Content: The Good: Location, location, location. Lovely small hotel overlooking the ocean. Staff we encountered were friendly and tried to be helpful. Rooms were well-appointed and bath amenties were of good quality. The Bad: FIRST ROOM had a used bar of soap in the shower and the AC did not work. Our room temp wouldn't go lower than 77 degrees. Returned mid-afternoon after housekeeping "cleaned" our room. The mirror had dried spatters on it (it wasn't dirty when we left the room) dirty glasses were replaced on the tray, and the iron and ironing board were left in the middle of the room (I put it in the corner when we left that morning). When I went to wash my hands I noticed that the "clean" hand towel was damp like someone dried their hands on it. Note: all towels were used by us and piled into the corner next to the tub. Went to use a robe and untied it only to find a long black hair inside the robe. This robe was not tied as neatly as the other one so I suspect housekeeping replaced a "used" robe on the hook. The Night Manager moved us to our SECOND ROOM because the AC was going to take a couple of days to fix. This room was the largest suite they had but we were told we could only stay for 1 night because it was booked the next day. Both balconies were very slippery like someone waxed the slate floor - wierd. This wasn't the case on our first room's balcony. My husband used the jacuzzi tub and the drain plug wouldn't come up so we had to pry it open with a knife. This huge and expensive room did not have a closet! There was 1 armoir with a rod but it was about 10 inches too short so our slacks and dresses. crumpled at the bottom. The manager seemed shocked at this revelation Our THIRD ROOM was mercifully free from any obvious issues but it was smaller than the room I originally booked but we were so tired of all the problems we just let it go. Kyla (sp?), the evening manager did everything she could to make-up for the myriad of problems and refunded (we paid in advance to get a special rate) a good portion of our payment. Her helpful attitude made an otherwise very disappointing and stressful stay a manageable one.

Reviews.Title: “Our mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sandy05051960
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotal. The only thing I will say is to book a room over looking the pool. We were over looking to street - and although a very quite street - we did hear a few cars during in night and in the AM , we did hear the waves also. If we would have been over the pool we would have only heard the ocean. There is a bike path right out side the hotal and stairs down to the water. There are many restaurants that you can walk to. We went to World Famous - perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: philliephan
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with our stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. One of the nicest hotels that I have stayed at and this is coming from some one that loves to travel and travel first class. Well done Pacific Terrace. As your governor would say, "I'll be back" (spoken in a thick German accent of course).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TomL1961
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located directly on the beach in Pacific Beach. The staff was awesome and the rooms are ultra clean and comfortable. I will definitly be going back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay,great beach/ocean view”
Reviews.Author: Marky1971
Reviews.Content: Greeted by friendly front desk and promptly shown to our room,which was a double king with ocean view,it was not a full ocean view but was still stunning.We were informed of vallet parking but also informed that the local parking on the road was ok and free[which we opted for]. The room was of nice size and the bathroom area was very spacious,i booked this hotel after reading lots of reviews on here and not having travelled to San Diego before,the location was ok if you have a rental which we did,and got to everything San Diego has to offer fairly quickly.It was nice to be by the beach/ocean and we even spotted dolphins from our balcony. The only gripe i had was that the room could have been a little cleaner.it looked like the carpet hadn't been vacumed for a while and the bathroom was a little dirty...but the beds were very comfortable,large and we had a great nights sleep,there is large flat screen tv and a spacious sitting area in the room,ipod docking station,fridge and coffee making facilities to boot. There is a great pool here and hot tub,which opened until 10pm. Breakfast is also available for an extra $6.50 which i thought should have been included in the room rate as it wasn't anything special,why charge $6.50 i dont get it. All in all i enjoyed my stay here,its not 5 star luxury a little rough around the edges but nice friendly comfortable hotel and i would return,although on a lovely walk along the beachfront one night,we noticed an old pier with lots of individual chalets a short walk from the hotel they looked quite large and had bbq's and a little backyard,i would try there next time,they were called Crystal Pier and did look a little unique if a little pricey

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lderuosi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the end of October, got a great rate and upon arrival Kyla offered us an ocean front family suite for $30 more per night. Room was beautiful and perfect for us with your 2 young children (3 and 6). The pool was just outside our door. Hotel was very convienent to the zoo and Seaworld, many restaurants very close by. We had a late night flight and we checked out friday am, left for the day, the front desk held our luggage and Kathy and Kyla we so very accomodating they allowed us to come back and use a room to shower and change and bathe our children before our flight. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: countindayz
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews, I was really excited about staying her. Until I arrived. The staff was not helpful and pleasant the whole time I was there. In fact they seemed bored, yet acted put out if you asked them a question. The rooms were very DARK and dated. - valet service is pitiful, extremely slow - front desk attitude is unapproachable - couldn' t use the laundry facility because from 11pm - 4 am the one of the staff members tied up all of the washer and dryers doing his family's laundry. I made the wrong assumption that the paying guests should come before an employee doing his family's laundry. - the fitness room is in the creepy underground parking garage which the homeless seem to visit often and scared me to death - security is non existant here. Any one off the street can walk up to your room. The door keys are turned off. - I felt so very unsafe for the first time at a hotel - breakfast was such low quality and felt like a cafeteria. I would never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Silent Crow
Reviews.Content: This is a review I've hesitated to write, because I didn't want to share this gem with anyone else. I've stayed in a great many wonderful hotels, and the Pacific Terrace ranks among the very best. It is, I dare say, my favorite hotel in North America. The views are absolutely sublime, and the rooms themselves are beyond comfortable. The friendly service is second to none. From the moment you arrive, you slow down. It is not a super-swift or efficient check-in process, but you very quickly discover that you don't WANT it to be. This is a place where everything is personal - at reception, you are instantly treated as a friend who deserves personalized service. It is, after all, a beautiful hotel on the beach, so why would you want to continue rushing? The hotel does not have an actual restaurant on the premises, but they have arranged room service with several of the local restaurants. In addition, a brief stroll down the beach takes you to Jordan's restaurant, where the food and service are MAGNIFICENT, and you can conveniently charge your meal to your room... I've now stayed there on numerous occasions, in 3 different style rooms. Yes, if they aren't full, you get an upgrade you will never forget, but even in the most basic room, you are bathed in the sound of the surf, while you sip cocktails on your private balcony. Would I return? Oh yes. I have, and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location with Friendly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JBJump
Reviews.Content: We were there for a brief visit in April - while the weather didn't cooperate we found the hotel precisely as advertised and the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful - we loved being there!

Reviews.Title: “Rivals 5 star/ 5 diamond establishments for service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Mamalikes2travel
Reviews.Content: Wait for a last minute rate, call and reserve non view room. If they aren't booked, upon check in you will get a free room upgrade. This is what yelp told me to do and it worked for us, we got a partial ocean view room for $149. It doesn't matter though, all rooms are very nice and the pool faces the ocean so just go out to the pool area for an incredible view! I have never received such great service at a hotel, we were so happy and blown away. It was a welcome change to such bad service out there.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are great, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: GenoBoulder
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. The room was great and had a wonderful view of the ocean. Location is great, close to walking and plenty of restaurants, even have their own driver(have to pay) who will take you anywhere. Even though we had an on-line deal thought the cost was high especially since there isn't an on-site restaurant. Breakfast is ok but would walk down the boardwalk or go next door to tower 21. Also, during the weekend locals cruise the hotels to get a deal on a room and have parties. Hotel was over-run with drunk people and staff did not address.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: MrBill425
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to spend our birthdays in San Diego this year and we decided on the Pacific Terrace Hotel for a couple of nights. When we arrived we were greeted friendly and professionally. We were a little early, but we were able to get our room right away. We rented the Ocean View Jr. King Suite, and all I can say is WOW. First off the hotel gave us a complimentary bottle of wine for our birthdays (the wine was excellent). I also called the hotel the day before to order roses for my girlfriend's birthday and the hotel took my order promptly. When we arrived, we walked into the biggest bouquet of roses I have ever seen. After receiving the bill at checkout the roses came to about 32 bucks (unbeatable unless you pick them yourself). The room was fantastic, the bed was comfy and the views were incredible. My girlfriend suprised me with couples massages at the hotel and that was the best massage ever. The hotel is a bit spendy, but I really think it was money well spent. No real complaints other than parking being 20 bucks a day. Overall this was an awesome experience and we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and cozy oceanfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: SilentScream
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pacific Terrace on our anniversary trip to San Diego. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Room was very spacious. We stayed on the 1st floor and our patio door opened to the garden-like patio. The hotel is very quiet and quite romantic due to the setting. There's an outdoor swimming pool along with jacuzzi. The parking is secure, although not free. Very basic breakfast is also included in the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beachfront Location”
Reviews.Author: SurferSeven
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel, perfect location on the beach. All staff were super helpful and friendly and went out of their way to make sure I had everything I needed. It was definitely a treat to stay there while I was visiting my family/friends in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kc_monk
Reviews.Content: This is an all-around great hotel. The location is perfect, up on a cliff above a really nice beach. You can walk 2 blocks and you have several restaurants/bars to chose from. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and quiet. We did pay for the "ocean view" room, but we had an ocean view off of our balcony. I believe all of the rooms have an ocean view. For this price (I paid $100 a night), this hotel is hard to beat if you want to stay in Pacific Beach. I will definitely go back, and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: mckinje
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace last month and it was the best hotel experience I could possibly ask for. The staff is incredible and the property is amazing. Every room has an unbelievable view, unmatched by anything in Pacific Beach or all of San Diego for that matter. Defiantly 4 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: bslayer44
Reviews.Content: We came to the Pacific Terrace Hotel for our very first trip to San Diego. From the moment we arrived till our departure we were treated like royalty!! Our room was incredible, the view unbelievable, the room service was fast, and everyone was very friendly and willing to go out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. I can not find anything negative to say. I do have to say that I had the best Pina Colada ever by the pool…my favorite drink! I will definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends and co-workers and we will be back…I promise!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bet in Pacific Beach see comments sent to hotel”
Reviews.Author: LarryandChrisM
Reviews.Content: Couldn't wait to tell you about the great time we had at your hotel (9/24/09 - 10/01/09 Room 203) We've stayed here a few times before and made the mistake of trying other hotels in the area as well. This last trip proved to us that this is the only hotel for us, It has everything!!! Your staff is the best, and the only way to repay is to tell all our family, friends and co workers that they have to stay here when visiting San Diego. Here's a couple of photo's we took: Sunrise, Sunset, kite over hotel, extra room guest (This was fantastic to come back to the room after a day of sightseeing and find a new visitor had stopped by to keep us company) Other changes we noticed: room service food delivery, hot breakfast option, valet parking and drinks at the pool, keep the changes coming. We believe your staff is the best, so friendly, happy, and a true willingness to assist each and every guest that comes through the lobby. It would be so hard to single out anyone when each and everyone of them couldn't do more for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best first trip!!”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloLovesNY
Reviews.Content: We came to the Pacific Terrace Hotel for our very first trip to San Diego. I can tell you, every penny we spent was worth it!! The hotel is fabulous inside and out. My husband and I never get to travel much since we own our own business, but we felt like royalty here. We pulled up to the hotel and a very nice bellman was there to meet us right away. I believe his name was Paul. Very professional young man. When we went to check in, we were greeted with a big smile. The young lady, I believe her name was Cassie. She was very nice and had great advice on where we should go for lunch while we wait for our room to be ready. Not even an hour later, Cassie called us to let us know our room was ready. Again, she was there with a welcoming smile and hello. I would say she was my favorite person to talk to on our stay. Everything about the hotel was great: the pool service (Lily is very nice), the house keepers, the bellman, the front desk. This stay was just amazing and I would recommend it to anyone visiting San Diego and Pacific Beach for the first time! We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel we have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Kira1319
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions now and both stays were fantastic. Our first visit was so memorable, that for our honeymoon, after deciding to vacation in California for the week, we booked this hotel immediately. As soon as we walked in the lobby, we were greated with several smiling staff members who were very polite and helpful. During check-in, the staff makes you feel very welcome. After about 5 minutes of being in our room, we had a knock at our door and there was a member of the staff there with a bottle of champagne, two glasses, and a personalized note congradulating us on our recent marriage. Later on, someone called to make sure everything with the room was satisfactory and told us to let them know if we needed anything at all. Our view from our balcony was amazing. The rooms are very comfortable and very quiet. Everything about the hotel is luxurious and elegant. There were a couple of times we called to the front desk, one time to ask about a restaurant recommendation, and they had a brochure and coupons to our room in probably 2 minutes! You will not be dissapointed in the slightest with this hotel. The views are spectacular, the area is safe, the rooms are clean and beautiful, and most of all, the staff is very helpful and always polite. They really go out of their way to make your stay as wonderful as possible.

Reviews.Title: “This place is BEAUTIFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lestersmommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the final 2 days of our "great California adventure" We booked the 3rd floor presidential suite and it was AMAZING. I was lucky enough to use my entertainment book and got the suite for 1/2 price. We had a huge balcony overlooking the pool and ocean. It had a great table and chairs and we sat for hours enjoying the view and the wine! The staff was kind and left us some champagne for our anniversary This was easily the NICEST hotel I have ever slept in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thehowedogs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a short holiday in the San Diego area. We wanted a room with a view of the ocean and this hotel definitely has that. It is adjacent to the boardwalk which has a steady stream of joggers, cyclists, etc. The view of the ocean is great, the rooms are very nice, and house keeping does an excellent job. There are lots of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: kircc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. We were looking for a relaxing getaway that overlooked the ocean and that is exactly what we got with the Pacific Terrace hotel. The rooms were spotless and had everything we needed, including a small fridge. We stayed in a partial ocean view which was perfect. It overlooked the beach and looked down the coast to La Jolla. We thought our room was much better than those overlooking the pool as the pool area tended to get noisy. We never ate breakfast at the hotel but did try the drinks one night. They definitely were not worth the price. With the fridge in the room, we then made our own on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star - or worth of 7th Most Popular in SD”
Reviews.Author: The996
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an alternative since Tower 23 was booked for the Labor Day weekend. Needless to say, we should have just gone somewhere else. Foremost, there is absolutely NO way this hotel is a 4 star. No restaurant on site, small pool, underwhelming rooms with hideous decor, uncomfy beds and pillows that were a joke. The ceiling fan is wobby, dusty, cob webs, boy oh boy. And, we had the suite, which is just a bigger room with a pathetic ocean view. Not only was there a palm tree obstructing our view, but we were so sunk in, it was really a partial view. All this magnificence for $400 a night. And it smelled like weed. Trust me, if you're looking for a hotel and you're not expecting much, this might work for you. If you're looking for something trendy, hip, with views, great food, etc, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: txfamily4
Reviews.Content: PT looks great from the outside,,,just like the pictures. Check in was pleasant. I was disappointed because we paid the rate for a partial view and got a 1st floor room. If we stood just right we could see the ocean through the pool area, sidewalk and trees. Not what I had in mind. Our room was outside the reception area, elevator and next to the common computer. Normally I would be very unhappy about that. However, I was traveling with my family that included young children so the location was helpful plus they could run out our sliding doors to the pool. They loved that. We had a king suite that included a small refrigerator and microwave. The room was nice and large. The sofa bed had a nice air mattress that was very comfortable. It was a very quiet hotel and we never heard any noises. My kids want to go back. The location on the beach was great. They provided beach toys for the kids. We shopped at the grocery store and mostly ate in the room because the kids were so tired each night plus we had a hard time finding family places to eat. The pool was nice but the water was cloudy which made me concerned that perhaps chlorine levels were not maintained. We were disappointed that they charged us for beach chair and umbrella given the price of the room. The internet connection on the common computer was extremely slow,,,,dialup level.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace was the right choice!”
Reviews.Author: jkbanta
Reviews.Content: It's the best hotel on Pacific Beach! The room was so comfortable with a fantastic view, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again. Ask for 2nd or 3rd floor rooms - the views are much better.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Ready4MoreBeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace from July 2 to July 7. We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and its proximity to the ocean. The hotel is wonderful. All of the staff, from check-in, to the maid service, the bellhops, even the maintenance guys in the elevator were awesome and made us feel like special guests. Pros -Hotel is super clean, very nice overall -Rooms are awesome and decorated with real furniture not the normal cheap hotel stuff! -Nice pool with great bar service from very helpful staff -The view of the ocean is awesome. We had an Oceanfront King on the 2nd floor. I would try to get one of the end rooms that face the ocean when I return. All have awesome views but the hotel is sort of C shaped facing the ocean. The end rooms have the awesome view but don't have to overlook the pool. Either way, the view is awesome and will not disappoint. -Location is within walking distance to all sorts of original restaurants. Ask the front desk, they will guide you. Make sure you eat at Taco Surf, just 1 block away on the main road. Its a wonderful little dive Mexican restaurant. Very clean and delicious. The kids (ages 3 & 5) liked the pizza next door and I was able to bring it in to Taco Surf. Cons - these are nit picky but you cannot review all positives! -A little pricey. I booked on their website and chose the Internet prepay deal. The price ended up going down a bit, so I called and was upgraded. But, I would say the price is justified given the service, location, and cleanliness of this hotel. -Self parking is $20 per day. With the price of the rooms, this should be included. Good luck parking the car if you refuse to use their parking. -I called to ask if they were on the beach. I was told they are 15 steps from the beach. Not true, they are 15 feet from the beach, but if you took 15 steps towards the beach, you would fall down a 30 foot cliff. Now, however, they are on an awesome boardwalk and located between 2 sets of stairs to get to the beach. The stairs are probably 45 feet in either direction. We explored the area quite a bit, and we believe this is the nicest beachfront hotel in the area. There are so many nice touches, from the furniture, to the turn down service, to the printed information delivered to your room telling you what staff is available overnight even with their pictures, and just the overall great, secure feeling you have while staying here. Overall this is an awesome hotel and please do not hesitate to stay here. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in San Diego!!!”
Reviews.Author: VEGASMAN21
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here one time before in 2006 and loved it. We had already booked 4 nights at Loew's Coronado, but wanted to start our trip early and stay somewhere else the night before. I was watching the rates on Expedia and I saw the Pacific Terrace had a "run of the house" room for $99!!! The rates for the hotel normally range between $330-$550 during the summer. This was a great deal, so I booked it. I knew that this rate was most likely for a "non-ocean view", but I was hoping that we could upgrade when we got there. I called the hotel before we left and they told me that they had quite a few rooms left so I knew that we had a good chance of getting upgraded. When we got there, they offered us a "full ocean view" room for only $30 more!!! What a bargain! So we paid $129 for a full ocean view in the middle of the summer. So I would like to give my thanks to the crappy economy for making this possible. As for the room, it was flawless as it was back in 2006. We were on the 3rd floor and the views were incredible. The decor of the room was awesome and you can tell that they spared no expense when this place was built (or refurbished). If I had my choice, I would have brought a pillow out on the balcony and slept there. Hands down, this is one of my favorite hotels in San Diego and one of the top 10 in the country. I have stayed at many, many top rated hotels throughout the country and I can tell you that this one is right up there. While there are some negatives (no restaurant), I can overlook those based on the views, room quality, and friendliness of the staff. By the way, they offer free internet as well!!! I only wish that this place was still an "unfound gem" as it was back in 2006 when the rates were low. Now it has priced itself accordingly and I am not sure if I can justify ever paying $550 per night for an ocean view. Oh well, there is always other places to discover.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Relax and Unwind”
Reviews.Author: RogerMKE
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Pacific Terrace hotel. It is a great place to go if you want to relax and unwind. We rented a family suite, which was fairly expensive, but reasonably roomy and allows someone to hang out in the living room and watch TV while others are sleeping in the bedroom. I highly recommend an ocean view. Architecturally, the hotel is a very nice building. Our room was considerably nicer than our room at the Ritz-Carlton in Marina Del Ray. The staff was very friendly and attended to all our needs. There is not really a restaurant in the hotel (except for breakfast) but there are a number of casual places to eat within walking distance. The neighborhood around the hotel isn't anything to write home about -- it's a slightly run down beach community. When you are not hanging out at the beach or pool, you will probably want to drive somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter789
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace is a great hotel! The check in staff was very pleasant, even offering suggestions for places to park free in the area. Being a popular part of town we didn't have any luck findind a spot, but the underground garage was secure and easy! A few reviews rip this hotel for not having a place to eat which is totally lame. If you are visiting a new city do you really want to eat at a hotel restaurant? Why not try one of the countless places within walking distance? We tried several, all good to great! Overall, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for but I would ask for a floor plan first.......”
Reviews.Author: swa7381
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable place! Yes it is pricey but it has everything you expect. The staff was extremely helpful and very nice. 5 star resort setting on a small scale. 3 Floors of varying size rooms from small one bed to two room suites. It does make a big difference where your room is and if you pay the same 400/nite as the next guy you want as much bang for your buck. Room placement and size can vary and that's why if you do your homework wether google maps or call for a floor plan first it would be a huge benefit. The only complaint was when my family stayed in a 1st floor room with a partial ocean veiw(plenty of ocean veiw) the noise from upstairs esp when the guy above moves his patio chairs all nite long. It's so loud it comes thru the ceiling! I asked to be moved and was taken care of immediately, still if the family above has a kid or for some reason has to keep moving it will keep you up all nite, even with ear plugs! My new room was smaller and still the room above kept us up. There a certain rooms that are smaller and thats why a floor plan with room #s can help, find the room of YOUR choice and when you get that big hotel bill you will know it was worth it! ps 20 bucks a day to park underground with roll up gates only accessable with hotel card.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: SLCUTTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Pacific Terrace for a total of 6 nights for our anniversary and had a wonderful time. The staff was some of the most friendly hotel staff we have encountered. We were lucky enough to get an upgrade to a suite. The room was huge, clean, had an ocean view with a very large balcony. If you're looking to stay in Pacific Beach, Pacific Terrace has the best location you can find. It's backdoors open to the boardwalk, with Tourmaline (for surfing) just a few steps away. There's also a variety of restaurants and stores within walking distance. For more upscale dining, you can drive into La Jolla in a matter of minutes. When we go back to Pacific beach, we will be staying at the Pacific Terrace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Never again. The economy has kicked this hotel's [--]!”
Reviews.Author: vendorcloud
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel the first time we went early in 2008. What a difference a year and 4 months makes. The PT was #1 ranked back then. Now, it's dropped to a 5 or so. I still went hoping all was well. When we arrived check-in was fine and fluid. No qualms. We had a so-so rate for the weekend and an ocean view suite. We anticipated the whole pool experience in the car going down from LA. When we got down there we were met by a half dozen youngish thugs with stretched ear lobe rings, full body tats and a few had that glazed look of "where am I?" on their faces. There were all guys except one girl who was in a bathing suit that was 3 sizes too small for her body. Not pretty for the family scene. They began to smoke and carry on. It's all good, believe me. I was a punk once too. But not for $400 thanks. The concierge and my wife had a mis communication about dinner reservations but it was finally worked out. We went to the trendy JRDN at the Tower 23 hotel a few blocks away. The babysitter that the hotel arranged was great btw. JRDN started off with a thud. There's lots to write here but I will leave it to Urbanspoon. Look for my review there. Just prepare yourself for lots of trendy but no substance. We inquired about the change in guest profile and were told they would "ask them to calm down" if need be. Ya.... no thanks. I don't need to be shot in the garage. These guys were about 5 or 6 to a room btw. I know that was not on the rules list. The free hot breakfast has been changed to a $7.50 hot breakfast with lots of $2.00 add ons. We opted for the free continental. It was fine. The supposed Starbucks coffee was weak. Go down the beach a bit and have a better coffee (and probably breakfast) at Konos. The beach here is not fluffy white but that is ok. If you are looking for Hawaii, San Diego ain't it. But all in all the hotel's location is prime. In fact, if they didn't have the location, they'd probably be out of business at this point. Upon check out the concierge (Katherine?) was very helpful and offered to do anything to make all the woes go away. She gave me free parking ($20) which I didn't ask for. It's funny. They always think it's about the money. It's not. Get rid of the party at the pool and I would have paid $500. The sad part was that she was so earnest in her effort to help, the other "customer service" agents at the desk (Matt and another gal) were making fun of her while I was being helped. Get a plan for a new job guys. You won't be here much longer but I'm sure the concierge will find a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Blew our minds away”
Reviews.Author: Skooter430
Reviews.Content: We were originally supposed to stay at the Hilton on Mission Bay for our honeymoon, until i read the reviews of the Pacific Terrace. Everything I read I wanted to experience. Being right on the water with nice rooms. So I cancelled our reservations for the Hilton and Booked with the Pacific Terrace. We were not dissapointed. The view was spectacular and the grounds were beautiful and the employees were very nice. We had booked a Junior Suite w/king bed. The room was very well laid out. We were also able to see the ocean from our bed every morning and listen to the waves during the night. We also went there knowing that they didnt have an onsite restaraunt but were shocked to find that they did have a small breakfast available. The food was better than we had thought it would be for the price we had paid for it. The restaraunts around the hotel were also great. We went to Gringos for lunch and Fat Burger. We tried everything at least once. We deff. plan on staying here again, it was an unbelievable honeymoon, thank you for the memories.
